name: wavesoftware-glassfish
author: Krzysztof Suszy≈Ñski
description: This plugin for Puppet installs Glassfish Application Server and adds resource types and providers for managing Glassfish domains, system-properties, jdbc-connection-pools, jdbc-resources, custom-resources, auth-realms and application deployment by using the asadmin command line tool. This plugin uses the executable `asadmin` of Glassfish instalation. Plugin installs Glassfish in version `3.1.2.2` as standard and using `java-7-oracle` (also supports other JDK versions: `java-7-oracle`, `java-7-openjdk`, `java-6-oracle`, `java-6-openjdk`). It will also starts it as a service.
summary: A plugin to manage Glassfish instalation and domains, system-properties, jdbc-connection-pools and jdbc-resources and application deployment.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: The system property key.

parameters.name: value
parameters.doc: The system property value.

parameters.name: portbase
parameters.doc: The Glassfish domain port base. Default: 4800

parameters.name: asadminuser
parameters.doc: The internal Glassfish user asadmin uses. Default: admin

parameters.name: passwordfile
parameters.doc: The file containing the password for the user.

parameters.name: user
parameters.doc: The user to run the command as.

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: The Glassfish domain name.

parameters.name: smf
parameters.doc: Create Solaris SMF service. Default: true

parameters.name: startoncreate
parameters.doc: Start the domain immediately after it is created. Default: true

parameters.name: name
parameters.doc: The custom resource name.

parameters.name: restype
parameters.doc: The type of custom resource to be created. Specify a fully qualified type definition, for example javax.naming.spi.ObjectFactory. The resource type definition follows the format, xxx.xxx.

parameters.name: factoryclass
parameters.doc: Factory class name for the custom resource. This class implements the javax.naming.spi.ObjectFactory interface.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.doc: Optional attribute name/value pairs for configuring the resource. As String or Hash. Ex. "user=myuser:password=mypass"

parameters.doc: The internal Glassfish user asadmin uses. Default: admin

parameters.doc: The user to run the command as.
